Interface DGAttack

All Known Implementing Classes:
DGSimpleAttack, Heal
public interface DGAttack

This is the interface that should be implemented by all attack classes. It contains the basic methods called by the battle system. How these methods are implemented doesn't matter as long as they do what they're supposed to.

Version:
0.1 Java
Author:
Evan Hildreth, root -1 Entertainment

Method Summary
 int Draw()
          Returns amount of MP needed to attack
 int Exe(DGCharacter attacker, DGCharacter defender)
          Executes the attack.
 boolean IsMagic()
          Whether this is a magic or physical based attack.
 boolean IsTeam()
          Returns whether or not attack attacks a whole team or just one person

          Gets the name of the attack
 int Pow()
          Returns relative power of the attack
 java.lang.String Status()
          Returns a string representation (the name) of any DGStatus possibly inflicted by this attack.
 int Type()
          Returns the type of the attack as given in the DGTypeHandle class.
 

Method Detail

Draw

public int Draw()
Returns amount of MP needed to attack
Returns:
Attack's draw

Exe

public int Exe(DGCharacter attacker,
               DGCharacter defender)
Executes the attack. What the attack does is anyone's guess, but it should involve the attacker performing some damage to either the defender or the defender's whole team.
Parameters:
attacker - DGCharacter making the attack
defender - DGCharacter defending against the attack
Returns:
amount of damage done

IsMagic

public boolean IsMagic()
Whether this is a magic or physical based attack. If this method returns true, then the Exe() method should use the GetMagAtkPow() method from the character (if the attack depends on the character's Mag level).
Returns:
true if magic-based attack

IsTeam

public boolean IsTeam()
Returns whether or not attack attacks a whole team or just one person
Returns:
If attack attacks whole team

Name

public java.lang.String Name()
Gets the name of the attack
Returns:
Attack's name

Pow

public int Pow()
Returns relative power of the attack
Returns:
Attack's power

Status

public java.lang.String Status()
Returns a string representation (the name) of any DGStatus possibly inflicted by this attack. Multiple statuses should be seaperated by carrage returns ('\n'). "None" should be returned if there are none.
Returns:
Name of any statuses inflicted by attack

Type

public int Type()
Returns the type of the attack as given in the DGTypeHandle class.
Returns:
Attack's type
